intro: Canephora axillaris, commonly known as the axillary canephora, is a climbing plant native to tropical regions of Africa. It belongs to the Rubiaceae family, which includes many species of flowering plants. The plant is characterized by its slender stems and small, opposite leaves that often have a hairy texture. It produces small, white or pale yellow flowers, followed by berries that are typically red when mature. This species is often found in humid, shaded environments and is sometimes used in traditional medicine.
